resolution.name: Not A Problem

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

worklogs.comment:
bkietz commented on pull request #6465: ARROW-7894: [C++] Add preprocessor definitions for all cmake options
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6465
 
 
   Removes the need for `add_definitions()` calls which wrap cmake options, simplifying build configuration.
   
   Some options have been renamed to accommodate this:
   - ARROW_ENABLE_TIMING_TESTS -> ARROW_WITH_TIMING_TESTS
   - ARROW_BUILD_BENCHMARKS_REFERENCE -> ARROW_WITH_BENCHMARKS_REFERENCE
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

bkietz commented on issue #6465: ARROW-7894: [C++] Move preprocessor definitions from cmake files to arrow/config.h.cmake
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6465#issuecomment-589988920
 
 
   Probably not a candidate for moving to config.h:
   
   parquet/CMakeLists.txt:135
   ```cmake
   if(CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_ID STREQUAL "GNU" AND CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_VERSION VERSION_LESS "4.9")
     add_definitions(-DPARQUET_USE_BOOST_REGEX)
     list(APPEND PARQUET_BOOST_LINK_LIBS ${BOOST_REGEX_LIBRARY})
   endif()
   ```

fsaintjacques commented on pull request #6465: ARROW-7894: [C++] Move preprocessor definitions from cmake files to arrow/config.h.cmake
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6465#discussion_r384039921
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -837,3 +810,10 @@ config_summary_message()
 if(${ARROW_BUILD_CONFIG_SUMMARY_JSON})
   config_summary_json()
 endif()
+
+# Write out arrow and third party package configurations.
+
+configure_file("src/arrow/config.h.cmake" "src/arrow/config.h")
 
 Review comment:
   1. You don't want to pollute your source tree with this, otherwise it'll break when one is using multiple build configuration (I do), see [ARROW_ADD_PKG_CONFIG](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/cmake_modules/BuildUtils.cmake#L803-L807) for something similar. This works for the `util/config.h` because there's nothing of importance in there. But it'll definitively break with define guards, e.g. ARROW_WITH_DATASET.
   2. `.cmake` is not idiomatic, use `.in`, every package manager / OSS / C developer will understand. You can replace the one in `util` too.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

bkietz commented on pull request #6465: ARROW-7894: [C++] Move preprocessor definitions from cmake files to arrow/config.h.cmake
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6465#discussion_r384048093
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -837,3 +810,10 @@ config_summary_message()
 if(${ARROW_BUILD_CONFIG_SUMMARY_JSON})
   config_summary_json()
 endif()
+
+# Write out arrow and third party package configurations.
+
+configure_file("src/arrow/config.h.cmake" "src/arrow/config.h")
 
 Review comment:
   1. This directive doesn't put the generated file into your source tree, it goes to a location in the cmake build directory which overrides "src/arrow/config.h"
   2. The file includes `#cmakedefine` directives, which do the reasonable thing with an `ON/OFF` value. I can refactor to use `.in` if you prefer
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Several build options are mirrored as preprocessor definitions, for example \{{ARROW_JEMALLOC}}. This could be made more consistent by requiring that every option in DefineOptions should also define a preprocessor macro with {{add_definitions}}.

comments.body: We now have {{arrow/util/config.h.cmake}} which automatically exports the definitions listed in that file, so it's just a matter of adding the desired ones there.
Reopened and reclosed to unassign. Bloody JIRA.
